name: 5fcfa5f6-0e9e-467a-8de0-eba7df6792c7
displayName: Importing a zip file with 835 transactions

text.text: Where can I find the option to import a zip file with 835 transactions?

text: To import a zip file with 835 transactions, you can click the "Create a transaction" button on the Payments page. You can also click the deposit date of the 835.

text.text: What is the size limit for the zip file I can import for bulk remittance?

text: The file size limit for claim attachments is 500 MB.

text.text: Can you explain the default remit import timeout for bulk imports?

text: The default remit import timeout for bulk imports is 10 minutes.

text.text: How can I check the status of the bulk import after uploading the zip file?

text: You can check the status of the bulk import by hovering over Claims on the navigation bar and clicking Imported claims. The most recent imported file displays at the top of the page. You can identify the file by its file name, import date, or PCR number.

text.text: What information does the Remittance Batch Status page provide for each imported file?

text: The Remittance Batch Status page provides the following information for each imported file: Batch number, Submission status, Submission date, Claim count, Batch filename, Receipt verified, Clearinghouse ID, Will queue, Claim status, Claim numbers

text.text: Is it possible to open each individual remit file from the Remittance Batch Status page?

text: Yes, it is possible to open each individual remit file from the Remittance Batch Status page. To do this, click on the "View" link next to the file name. This will open the file in a new window.

text.text: Who is the "Imported By" user displayed on the Remittance Batch Status page?

text: The "Imported By" user is the user who imported the remittance batch.

text.text: What does the "Resolved" checkbox indicate for failed imports?

text: The "Resolved" checkbox indicates that the user has resolved the issue that caused the import to fail.

text.text: How can I filter the entries on the Remittance Batch Status page?

text: You can filter the entries on the Remittance Batch Status page by using the following criteria: Status, Status reason, Batch ID, Import date, Import time, Imported by, Resolved.

text.text: What does it mean if a blue information icon appears next to the file's status?

text: If a blue information icon appears next to the file's status, you can view or edit payer (including subscriber) information.

text.text: Where can I access the payments page to work on individual files within the bulk import?

text: The imported files will appear in the morning in your Current tab on the Payments page. They will be easy to locate - their deposit date shows as " TBD . " To work the imported claims : 1. Click TBD under the " Deposit date " column.

text.text: What does "TBD" signify under the "Deposit date" field on the Payments page?

text: TBD means to be determined.

text.text: How can I navigate to the Transaction page from the Payments page?

text: To navigate to the Transaction page from the Payments page, click Payments in the navigation bar and then click Create a transaction. This will take you to the Line-item Editor page or the New Transaction page.

text.text: What action can I take if I need to delete a transaction from the TBD page?

text: To delete a transaction, you can click the transaction amount. This will open a list of the posted line items. From this window, you can delete an individual transaction, reverse the entire transaction, or edit the transaction.

text.text: What message will be displayed on the Dashboard if there are unresolved errors on the import?

text: If a NEMSIS or batch import fails, there is a clickable warning message that displays in the upper left corner of the Dashboard.

text.text: How do I access the Remittance Batch Status page to resolve import issues?

text: To access the Remittance Batch Status page, you can go to Analytics > Reports. You can also find the permission under Analytics > Reports. If the permission was inherited via a role, that permission highlights in blue. If the permission was manually assigned, it won't have a highlight.

text.text: What steps should I take to resolve import issues and clear the alert message on the Dashboard?

text: If there are issues with the patient on the imported claim, you will need to verify the patient information. In this case, the imported claim will display in the "Incomplete - Verify patient account" button on the Dashboard.

text.text: explain Bulk Remittance Import.

text: Bulk remittance import is when you import a bulk facility data directly into ZOLL Billing. The import file has to be in a specific format, so you can use a template to follow. You can find the template by clicking Upload facilities on the Facilities page. The facility designations names must be an exact match.

text.text: what is the Size limit for the .zip file?

text: The file size limit for claim attachments is 500 MB.

text.text: How can I perform bulk import?

text: To perform bulk import, you can click Upload facilities on the Facilities page. You can also find the template by clicking Upload facilities on the Facilities page. The import file has to be in a specific format, so you can use the template to follow. The facility designations names must be an exact match.

text.text: How to check the status of the bulk import?

text: When the status bar completes, you can click Import.

text.text: what are the  filters on the Remittance Batch Status page?

text:
The Remittance Batch Status page has the following filters:

* Facility: This filter allows you to select a specific facility.
* Status: This filter allows you to select the status of the remittance batch.
* Date Range: This filter allows you to select a date range for the remittance batch.
* Import Type: This filter allows you to select the type of import.
* File Name: This filter allows you to select a specific file name.

text.text: how is Unresolved errors messaging useful?

text: Unresolved errors messaging is useful because it can inform you of problems or critical issues. As you import or manually enter information, and as the claim moves through various stages of processing, the system continuously validates claim information against its billing rules. To inform you of successful actions and warn you about problems or critical issues, the system provides validation banners.
